On the same day, Carter named Zbigniew Brzezinski as National Security Advisor. Brzezinski clashed with Vance over the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan, the Iran hostage crisis, and the arming of the Contras in Nicaragua.

For instance, experiments cannot test many hypotheses or answer certain questions about the natural world. It would be difficult—and maybe unethical—to design an experiment to study how earthquakes affect humans. We could not take people and shake them to simulate the impact of an earthquake. There are many questions about nature that cannot be answered by experimentation because it is not moral or practical. Observation, or the act of noting and recording a natural phenomenon in a systematic fashion, is a basic component of science. Sometimes observations lead to questions about “why” and “how” that cannot be answered without experimentation. hyp_text: Mutations in genes can have a wide range of effects. Some mutations are silent and do not change the amino acid sequence of a protein. For example, if the codon CAA mutates to the codon CAG, the same amino acid (glutamine) will be produced, because CAA and CAG both code for glutamine. Mutations that do change the amino acid sequence of a protein can result in a protein with impaired or novel function. Each cell has thousands of genes that code for thousands of proteins, which carry out the functions necessary for a healthy human body. When a mutation alters a protein that plays a critical role in the body, a disease may develop. A condition caused by mutations in one or more genes is called a genetic disorder.

hyp_text: Ottawa is the capital of Canada, the seat of the federal government, and a city of nearly one million people. The city is located on the south bank of the Ottawa River in the eastern portion of Southern Ontario. Ottawa borders Gatineau, Quebec, and forms the core of the Ottawa-Gatineau census metropolitan area (CMA) and the National Capital Region (NCR). As of 2016, Ottawa had a city population of 934,243 and a metropolitan population of 1,323,783 making it the fourth-largest city and the fifth-largest CMA in Canada. In June 2019, the City of Ottawa estimated it had surpassed a population of a million. Founded in 1826 as Bytown, and incorporated as "Ottawa" in 1855, the city has evolved into the political centre of Canada. Its original boundaries were expanded through numerous minor annexations and were ultimately replaced by a new city incorporation and major amalgamation in 2001 which significantly increased its land area. The city name "Ottawa" was chosen in reference to the Ottawa River nearby, the name of which is derived from the Algonquin Odawa, meaning "to trade". The city is the most educated in Canada, and is home to a number of post-secondary, research, and cultural institutions, including the National Arts Centre, the National Gallery, and numerous national museums. Ottawa has the highest standard of living in the nation and low unemployment. It ranked 2nd nationally and 24th worldwide in the quality of life index and is consistently rated the best place to live in Canada. It is one of the most expensive cities to live in Canada. In 2016, MoneySense rated it as the best community in Canada to live in.

It is also known in English-speaking countries as walking, rambling, or bushwalking. The word hiking is understood in all English-speaking countries, although rambling (to ramble) is also common in Great Britain, and bushwalking is used in Australia. In the United States, Canada, the Republic of Ireland, and United Kingdom, hiking means walking outdoors on a trail, or off trail, for recreational purposes. A day hike refers to a hike that can be completed in a single day. However, in the United Kingdom, the word walking is also used, as well as rambling, while walking in mountainous areas is called hillwalking.
